item.title: Tinnitus biobank needed to explain ringing ears condition
item.description: A charity says a biobank library of human tissue is needed so experts can try to cure tinnitus.

item.title: Covid: Tough new targets will tackle NHS backlog, Boris Johnson says
item.description: Boris Johnson promises action after plans to tackle record waiting lists in England are delayed.

item.title: Improving cancer care a huge challenge post-pandemic
item.description: Charities warn of more missed diagnoses because of Covid, as the government plans a "war on cancer".

item.title: Paralysed man with severed spine walks thanks to implant
item.description: World first using electrical implant developed by a team of Swiss researchers

item.title: Libmeldy: World's 'most expensive' drug recommended for NHS use
item.description: The gene therapy Libmeldy treats babies and children with a very rare genetic condition.

item.title: Surgical mesh centres not working, warn MPs
item.description: A debate in Westminster hears that GPs are not always aware of the referral process.

item.title: Novavax Covid jab approved by UK drugs regulator
item.description: UK regulator the MHRA says Nuvaxovid is safe as a first and second dose in adults.

item.title: NHS Tracker: How is the NHS in your area coping this winter?
item.description: Winter and Covid are putting the NHS under severe strain, find out what's happening in your area.

item.title: Deaf people diagnosed with cancer face 'big barriers'
item.description: Coleen McSorely says the barriers she faced included being unable to lip-read medics wearing masks.

item.title: Plans to sell vaginal HRT tablets over the counter
item.description: GPs, pharmacists and the public in England are being asked for their views on the proposal.

item.title: The myth of a 'super-charged' immune system
item.description: Suddenly we are all talking about immunity but how much do we really understand?

item.title: How HIV elimination is within Australia's reach
item.description: Australian HIV cases have hit an all-time low - and it's partly a legacy of unconventional strategy.

item.title: Pfizer and BioNTech start trials of new Omicron-specific jab
item.description: The companies have adapted their original vaccine to target the fast-spreading variant.

item.title: Thousands needed to try a new Covid antiviral treatment
item.description: A UK study aims to find out who will benefit most from a pill designed to treat Covid-19.

item.title: Hymen repair surgery and virginity testing to be banned in UK
item.description: The practice is linked to virginity in some cultures and has been described as a form of violence.

item.title: Long Covid: Ipswich Hospital worker says it has changed her life
item.description: Jodi Avery experiences fatigue, breathlessness and brain fog after contracting coronavirus twice.

item.title: Omicron: How do I know if I have it?
item.description: The symptoms are similar to a cold, while genetic analysis is the only way to confirm the variant.

item.title: What are the Covid variants and will vaccines still work?
item.description: A new Covid variant has emerged that looks worryingly different to the one vaccines were designed to fight.

item.title: What are the Covid rules in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Covid rules are being eased across all four nations of the UK.

item.title: Covid: How to look after yourself at home
item.description: What can you expect if you have Covid, and when should you get extra help?

item.title: Covid vaccine ‘waning immunity’: How worried should I be?
item.description: Is the effectiveness of Covid vaccines waning over time? We look at how much protection being double vaccinated offers.

item.title: How do I book my Covid jab and does it work against Omicron?
item.description: The government has scrapped plans to make Covid jabs mandatory for frontline NHS staff in England.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Why are 12-15s now being double-jabbed?
item.description: All children aged 12 to 15 are being offered two doses of Covid vaccine.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the latest rules for face coverings and masks?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but are still recommended in some settings.

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: When can teenagers get a second dose?
item.description: All 16 and 17 year-olds in the UK can now have a second dose 12 weeks after the first.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

item.title: How to get a Covid test
item.description: Across the UK, people without symptoms no longer have to confirm a positive LFT result with a PCR.

item.title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms of coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
item.description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?
item.description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

item.title: Covid: Delays to a plan to tackle England's NHS backlog not down to money - Sajid Javid
item.description: The health secretary says the delay is to make sure everyone in government is behind the plan.

item.title: Fatherhood joy for paralysis implant dad
item.description: David M’zee received an electrical implant to his spine in 2017, it enables him to walk slowly and stand.

item.title: All-terrain wheelchair: ‘My chair is my freedom’
item.description: A woman says her all-terrain wheelchair means she can access the Peak District home she loves.

item.title: Lyme disease: Man spent £25,000 before getting diagnosis
item.description: Steven Williams, 36, said his fit, active life was "totally devastated" by the disease.

item.title: The NHS workers that faced UK's first Covid cases
item.description: Two years on, staff at Newcastle's Royal Victoria Hospital look back at the first weeks of the pandemic.
